column1: Giaginsky District (Russian: Гиаги́нский райо́н; Adyghe: Джэджэ къедзыгъо) is an administrative and a municipal district (raion)
column2: one of the seven in the Republic of Adygea
column3: Russia. It is located in the northern central portion of the republic and borders with Shovgenovsky District in the north
column4: Koshekhablsky District in the east and northeast
column5: Mostovsky District of Krasnodar Krai in the southeast
column7: and with Belorechensky District of Krasnodar Krai in the west. The area of the district is 756.54 square kilometers (292.10 sq mi). Its administrative center is the rural locality (a stanitsa) of Giaginskaya. As of the 2010 Census
column8: the total population of the district was 31
column10: with the population of Giaginskaya accounting for 44.5% of that number.

column1: Giaginsky District was established within Azov-Black Sea Krai on December 31
column2: 1934 as a result of the downsizing of that krai's districts. On April 10
column4: Khansky Selsoviet of Maykopsky District of the krai was merged into Giaginsky District and the latter
column5: along with the city of Maykop
column6: was transferred to Adyghe Autonomous Oblast. On February 1
column8: Maykopsky District of Adyghe Autonomous Oblast was merged into Giaginsky District to create Giaginsky Rural District (Гиа́гинский се́льский райо́н). However
column9: as the new system of rural districts did not prove to be efficient
column10: Giaginsky District was re-instated in its pre-1963 borders on January 12

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Giaginsky District is one of the seven in the Republic of Adygea and has administrative jurisdiction over all of its thirty rural localities. As a municipal division
column3: the district is incorporated as Giaginsky Municipal District. Its thirty rural localities are incorporated into five rural settlements within the municipal district. The stanitsa of Giaginskaya serves as the administrative center of both the administrative and municipal district.
